p: The Montrose Clinic (currently, Legacy Community Health Services) became established in 1978 as a grassroots organization to test and treat MSM for STIs, alongside the Montrose Counseling Center (currently, the Montrose Center) for mental health services, through the efforts of twin gay physicians, Robert and Richard Oâ€™Brien [ 8]. Both of these institutions evolved and thrived, providing crucial prevention, care and support services to the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer (LGBTQ) community and PWH. Their board members founded the AIDS Foundation Houston in 1982, the earliest Texas organization dedicated to prevention education and services [ 9].
